1.text: Be not many teachers, my brethren, knowing that we shall receive greater judgment.

2.text: For we all often offend. If any one offend not in word, he [is] a perfect man, able to bridle the whole body too.

3.text: Behold, we put the bits in the mouths of the horses, that they may obey us, and we turn round their whole bodies.

4.text: Behold also the ships, which are so great, and driven by violent winds, are turned about by a very small rudder, wherever the pleasure of the helmsman will.

5.text: Thus also the tongue is a little member, and boasts great things. See how little a fire, how large a wood it kindles!

6.text: and the tongue [is] fire, the world of unrighteousness; the tongue is set in our members, the defiler of the whole body, and which sets fire to the course of nature, and is set on fire of hell.

7.text: For every species both of beasts and of birds, both of creeping things and of sea animals, is tamed and has been tamed by the human species;

8.text: but the tongue can no one among men tame; [it is] an unsettled evil, full of death-bringing poison.

9.text: Therewith bless we the Lord and Father, and therewith curse we men made after [the] likeness of God.

10.text: Out of the same mouth goes forth blessing and cursing. It is not right, my brethren, that these things should be thus.

11.text: Does the fountain, out of the same opening, pour forth sweet and bitter?

12.text: Can, my brethren, a fig produce olives, or a vine figs? Neither [can] salt [water] make sweet water.

13.text: Who [is] wise and understanding among you; let him shew out of a good conversation his works in meekness of wisdom;

14.text: but if ye have bitter emulation and strife in your hearts, do not boast and lie against the truth.

15.text: This is not the wisdom which comes down from above, but earthly, natural, devilish.

16.text: For where emulation and strife [are], there [is] disorder and every evil thing.

17.text: But the wisdom from above first is pure, then peaceful, gentle, yielding, full of mercy and good fruits, unquestioning, unfeigned.

18.text: But [the] fruit of righteousness in peace is sown for them that make peace.
